import asyncio

# Define a simple coroutine that simulates a task
async def simulate_task(task_name, duration):
    print(f"Task {task_name}: Started")
    await asyncio.sleep(duration)
    print(f"Task {task_name}: Completed after {duration} seconds")
    return f"Result of {task_name}"

# Define a main coroutine that schedules multiple tasks
async def main():
    # Schedule three tasks to run concurrently
    task1 = asyncio.create_task(simulate_task("A", 2))
    task2 = asyncio.create_task(simulate_task("B", 3))
    task3 = asyncio.create_task(simulate_task("C", 1))
    
    # Wait for all tasks to complete
    results = await asyncio.gather(task1, task2, task3)
    print(f"All tasks completed with results: {results}")

# Run the main coroutine
asyncio.run(main())

# Intentional error: attempting to run an event loop that is already running
loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(main())
